document_data.name: Farmers' Quarter
document_data.mainbody: The '''Farmers' Quarter''' was the ward of [[Daggerford]] that housed the town's farmers and ranchers, along with some of their livestock. It was a bustling place that was just as uproarious as it was smelly.
document_data.Geography: The quarter was located in the northwest section of Daggerford.{{DagLoc}} It was just south of the rather small Farmer's Gate, that granted transportation of food and animals into town from the farms to the north.

Notable Locations.Businesses:
* [[Cromach's Smithy]]: Although it was established within the [[Caravan Quarter]], the long-standing smithy was relocated to the Farmer's Quarter where it was run by a dwarf named [[Tholvar Cragjaw]].
* [[Gublin's Cloth & Cordage]]: The proprietor of this shop enjoyed great success, thanks in part to a fantastic invention that entwined strands of rope together.
* [[Helmick's Herbs and Oddments]]: While they possessed no [[magic]]al powers, the curios sold within this establishment were said to have minor [[ward]]ing effects.
* [[Jerdan's Smithy]]: As of the late 15{{th}} century, [[Jerdan Went]] was the only human smithy operating within Daggerford.
* [[Potter's Wheel]]: This unexceptional shop was something of a front for its proprietor [[Marcus]], who was in fact an agent working for the duke.
* [[Ransaran's Sergeant-at-Arms]]: The skilled weaponsmith [[Ransaran]] forged high quality armaments and sold them for steep, but ultimately fair prices.
* [[Wiston Apothecary]]: A master of his profession, [[Wiston]] of [[Yartar]] was a physician who spent much of his time formulating new medicinal recipes.

{{Former}}
* [[Wayfel's Smithy]]: [[Wayfel]] offered lower-quality goods for cheaper prices compared to Daggerford's other smiths.
Notable Locations.Halls:
* [[Animal Handlers' Affiliation]]: As to be expected, this guild comprised Daggerford's drovers, ranchers, and veterinary physicians.
* [[Carpenters' Lodge]]: Among this guild's members were the town's numbers wainwrights, carpenters, and other wood-workers.
* [[Farmers' Society]]: This building served the many farmers who called Daggerford their home.
* [[Thieves' Brotherhood]]: The organized thieves of Daggerford established their headquarters within the Farmers' Quarter and utilized several empty buildings to carry out their illicit endeavors.
Notable Locations.Inns and Taverns:
* [[Dragonback Inn]]: This boarding house catered to the outdoormsen and farmhands that lived nearby.
* [[Happy Cow]]: Having been in the [[Hardcheese]] family for generations, this delightful tavern was well-loved by all the local farmers.
* [[River Shining Tavern]]: Previously located in the [[Caravan Quarter]], this grand establishment was an institution of Daggerford for well over a century.
Notable Locations.Landmarks:
* The Marketplace: Twice every [[tenday]], merchants and vendors from around the region set up stalls and sold all manner of goods and wares.
* [[Guildmasters' Hall]]: While this expansive building held the offices of the town's guildmasters, as well as some [[Waterdhavian]] mercantile agents.

{{Former}}
* [[Grand Playhouse]]: This magnificent theater was founded to bring a touch of culture and refinement to Daggerford, but saw little success and its building was eventually relegated to other use.
Notable Locations.Places of Worship: * [[Harvest House]]: The temple dedicated to [[Chauntea]] was the largest house of worship in Daggerford, and featured a grand central courtyard.
Notable Locations.Residences: * Pascal's Tenements: This large apartment building held a number of cramp living quarters, that were rented out by the building's owner [[Pascal]].

Inhabitants.14{{th}} Century:
A number of interesting folks lived in the area of Daggerford. Among them were:
* [[Cadogan]], an adventurer from the party known as [[Her Majesty's Reconnaissance Team]]
* [[Czszudleaux]], the master [[illusionist]]
* [[Filarion Filvendorson]], a skilled [[thief]] who was rumored to lead the [[Thieves' Brotherhood]]
* [[Filvendor Floshin]], the young and somewhat wild son of [[Elorfindar Floshin|Sir Elorfindar Floshin]]
* [[Shalendra Floshin]], a [[cavalier]] who served under a Waterdhavian baron
* [[Nicomantis]], the [[cleric]] with a unique connection to plants and insects
* [[Sherlen Spearslayer]], drillmaster of the [[Daggerford militia]]
* [[Liam Sunmist]], a [[Lathander]]ite priest of [[Morninglow Tower]]
* [[Vix]], the town's chandler
Inhabitants.15{{th}} Century:
* [[Kelson Darktreader]], the [[half-elven]] Master of the Hunt that served the town's dukes for several generations
* [[Isteval|Sir Isteval]], a semi-retired adventurer and former [[Purple Dragon knight|knight]] of the [[Purple Dragons]]
